sub_title: Senior Publications Manager at Global Reporting Initiative (GRI)
summary:
I am a multilingual publishing and communications professional with wide-ranging experience as editor, producer and brand manager in fields ranging from bookselling to visual storytelling and sustainability reporting. 

As producer and editor, my focus is in upholding high standards, from research and fact checking to copy editing, briefings for graphic design, and color proofing of photographic reproduction. I’ve edited and reviewed technical documents, headed complex productions, and delivered parallel editions of publications in multiple languages in print and online.

As brand manager, I’ve conceived logotypes, managed corporate visual identities, and written style manuals for the implementation of new brand guidelines. I am experienced in cross-cultural communication and have written and edited newsletters, press releases, and brochures to streamline corporate messaging.

As commissioning editor, I have worked with journalists and visual storytellers and collaborated with designers, writers, and publishers to develop award-winning books, exhibitions, apps, and websites, often with image as core content. This comprises over 50 photo book titles, including two decades of World Press Photo yearbooks. As curator, I have supervised the hanging of hundreds of photo exhibitions in galleries, museums, and other public spaces around the world.

I am critical and analytical with a flexible mind, and I can zoom in quickly from the big picture to small detail. Challenging stereotypes, celebrating diversity and authenticity, I believe that access to reliable information and engaging storytelling supports good decision-making and drives change.

projects.title: The State of News Photography: The Lives and Livelihoods of Photojournalists in the Digital Age
projects.description:
By Dr. Adrian Hadland, Dr. David Campbell and Prof. Paul Lambert. Commissioning editor for World Press Photo foundation Kari Lundelin. 

Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism, University of Oxford, in association with World Press Photo Foundation. 

The report presents results and analysis from the first international study into the current state and future of professional photojournalism. The results indicate a high degree of risk is experienced among professional photographers with a very strong correlation to the country in which they are based. The research analyses data taken from 1,500 professional photojournalists from more than 100 countries and is a partnership between the University of Oxford’s Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism, the University of Stirling’s journalism department and the World Press Photo Foundation, one of the premier platforms for the recognition of global excellence in photo and video journalism.

profile_positions.title: Editor, curator and communication consultant

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the journalistic and editorial integrity of the prizewinning work in the annual photo contest and for quality control of all presentation formats. 

Editor of World Press Photo 16 book: working together with the art director and caption writer; reaching out to ca. 50 photographers for additional context information; heading a team of researchers and fact checkers; accompanying the production manager to control proofs and to approve colour corrections at the printing press.

Researcher and editor for context and caption information in the searchable online image collection of 12,000 historical prizewinning pictures.

Curator of the World Press Photo 16 photo exhibition: working together with the art director, editing the jury selection into a coherent exhibition layout with respect for journalistic and artistic intents of the photographers, and the logistic constraints of a travelling exhibition; approving colour corrections at the photo lab, approving designs of promotional materials.

Authored an in-house curatorial training manual for the layout and installation of photo exhibitions.
Ran several three-day personal training sessions for exhibition project managers and curators on location in Germany, Italy, and Scotland. Ran in-house skills share sessions for the team of exhibition project managers.

Gave talks and lectures on photojournalism, viewed portfolios, and conducted guided tours to students at exhibitions in Germany, Poland, and the UK.
profile_positions.title: Senior Editor and Curator

profile_positions.description:
Strategic communication advisor. Headed the Communication Department team of specialists in  corporate communications, media contacts and client relation and research into trends and target audiences. Responsible for a corporate identity update and for editorial development and innovation. Editor of the yearbook and curator of the annual exhibition.

Responsible for department resources, budget and overall planning. Approved operational plans by project leaders. Responsible for the recruitment of staff and carrying out staff appraisals and target meetings. Mentor and contact person for interns working on dissertations.

Developed a new logotype and brand guidelines in cooperation with an agency. Wrote a corporate style manual for the implementation of visual guidelines and authored a corporate values and ethics manual. Approved promotional material concepts by partners, assessed proofs. Responsible for trademark registrations.

Supervised development of a new digital-first online strategy for multiple platforms, including apps and social media and a new website launched in 2011. Developed the first guidelines for the launch of social media pages on Facebook and Twitter.

Editor of the World Press Photo yearbook and newsletters; associate curator of the World Press Photo traveling photo exhibition. Developed the concept and edited the book series Next (Joop Swart Masterclass) and the book Stories of Change (Reporting Change workshops).

Member of the photo contest steering committee for invitations to judges, contest category definitions and entry rules. Commissioned baseline research into the photojournalistic practice.

Advised Managing Director and Deputy Managing Director on long-term strategy forming and implementation plan, including milestones and monitoring systems. Wrote concept and marketing plans for the World Press Photo Academy, including regional educational programs, a global photo book contest and a permanent multifunctional exhibition space.
profile_positions.title: Head of Communication

profile_positions.description:
Managed a team of six project managers who were responsible for the premium worldwide contest for photojournalists and the annual Awards Days, for the Joop Swart Masterclass for emerging talent and for a series long-term seminars for empowering photographers in the developing world.

Served as Deputy Managing Director, as member of the Managing Team and as member of the World Press Photo 50th Anniversary Festival Committee. Member of the photo contest steering committee, deciding on invitations to judges, contest category definitions and entry rules.

In cooperation with the Contest Manager, developed and carried out a relocation plan for the photo contest judging at the World Press Photo office, including judging schedules, hospitality program and staff rotas. Mentor for work experience interns.

Responsible for defining terms of reference for the long-term strategy development of the organization. Ran a series of strategy workshops for staff task teams in the Netherlands, Germany, France and Spain.

Commissioning editor of Things As They Are book. Producer and commissioning editor of Pleasure of Life book and an eponymous short documentary film shot on location in Bangladesh and in Bosnia-Herzegovina and premiered at the 2005 World Press Photo Awards Days.
